author: bachtis
body:
This is the PR on some minimalistic quality criteria in PF to reject tracks with very large Dpt/pt

Previous algorithm:
-Track goes in PF if belongs to  a muon or if Dpt/pt <N HCAL resolution. The second criterion is not applied for  muon seeded tracks since they were assumed the same with iteration 0

New algorithm:
-Track goes to PF if it belongs to a muon with at least a global refit with Dpt/pt<1 or if Dpt/pt <N HCAL resolution with N=5.

Since this changes implies differences in the configuration files and since HLT is not affected by this [suing other iterations ] I exploited the modular nature of the BLOCK Algo to copy the old importer to a new one and use the new one in the offline cfi file. So while code changes look to be a lot the change is really minimal.

For validation plots see my talk in PPD 23/09/2015
title: Improvements in track quality criteria in PF for muon seeded iterations
